greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = Product_{k=1..n} lcm(n,k).
comment: Log(a(n))/n/Log(n) is bounded since n^n < a(n) < n^(2n). It seems that lim n -> infinity Log(a(n))/n/Log(n) exists and = 1.7.... - _Benoit Cloitre_, Aug 13 2002
link: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n=1..100
formula: a(n) = n!*Product_{ d divides n } d^phi(d). - _Vladeta Jovovic_, Sep 10 2004
maple: A071248 := proc(n) mul( lcm(k,n),k=1..n) ; end: for n from 1 to 10 do printf("%d ",A071248(n)) ; od ; # _R. J. Mathar_, Apr 03 2007
xref: Product of terms in n-th row of A051173.
results.author: _Amarnath Murthy_, May 21 2002
